description:
The CGT-2000 detects even the most subtle changes in visual function that visual acuity tests would overlook. 

An advanced optical tool to test a person's sensitivity to contrast and brightness is Takagi's Contrast GlareTester. This innovative instrument, used in optometry and ophthalmology, assesses a person's capacity to identify objects under different illumination. It helps detect possible vision problems associated with glare sensitivity or contrast perception by exposing patients to controlled light levels. 

Diagnosing cataracts, macular degeneration, and other vision issues is made easier with the help of this tool. Eye care providers can create customised treatments to restore overall eye health and improve visual comfort using its exact measures.
